3WzykEIwgqzBbKh3FIECzA.text: My first and ONLY time Charr will get my money! The manager told me off, including using the "f" word, when I phoned about an incomplete delivery order. If they weren't in such a crappy location, I just may have visited in person. Now? Don't think so. There are far better burgers all over Phoenix.

Lr4mwbnarXDmiQ-Z4BETNg.text: While having to wait for an unexpected car repair, my friend and I chose Charr since it was close to my mechanic.  Not a big fan of the industrial decor, but if the food is good I can live with it. Well - ugh!  A far cry from a burger joint, the menu was uninspired. We ordered the basic Charr burger -  one medium rare, the other medium well and got them cooked exactly the same. The garlic bun was intriguing but we both would have preferred them warmed a little. Ketchup served as the condiment of choice? I would prefer Thousand Island Dressing and maybe toss in a couple pickles. Neither of us had ever tasted Truffle fries, and I can honestly say I will never bother seeking them out. The muscle bound staff stood like guardians at the path to the restrooms. My friend braved the trail past them, announcing she had been in better restrooms in gas stations. I decided to skip the use of the facilities. I think a staff could at least "fake" busy so you don't feel like cattle being surveyed by prospective bidders at an auction. Charr is totally off the list of restaurants, and I wouldn't bother trying any of the sister restaurants. I can understand why people find their reservations available - it's because no one really goes there. Too many good burgers in town - I've learned to accept a $10.00 burger like I accept gasoline over $3.50 a galloon. The difference is, I have to buy gas - but I can get good food elsewhere for that $10.00.  I only wish I was in possession of one of their coupons they put out regularly. A painful experience is better with a coupon.

ap5APC3F6tFIeQPGdRxayA.text: first, i'm not sure who decided this place wasn't good kids. unless you plan on saddling up to the bar with child in tow (if you do this, you should officially be labeled 'not good for kids'), i don't see why you couldn't bring the little ankle-biters along. we brought a 6-year-old, and she loved it. they even have a kids' menu.  we went on a sunday night, and everything was perfect. if you haven't yet had a hamburger on a huge garlic knot, you haven't lived. the fries are also excellent.  the decor is very minimal and nice. it's in a strange part of town for being so hipster-ish. i hope they survive.

ib2T6ZMAq-GaPusVp6so3g.text: What a great experience.  So happy we weren't let down.  We were customers of Aiello's when they were open (same Owners) and always had a great meal. Had the fish & chips & fries and it was great.  The fish was so mild and fresh and the breading was delicious...not over breaded.  My husband had the burger and I tasted it (of course) and agreed with him, that it was a winner.  The dessert we had was the blueberry bread pudding with whiskey sauce and it was a home run!!  Of course, the best part of the whole experience was Brian, who always took care of us at Aiello's and now is at Charr.  We will definitely be returning.....many times!!

B6eGkcko6aAVRVGA8pEpJA.text: Good burgers and service but not spectacular. Both my son and I had the fish and chips last time both ended up getting sick. Burgers are good but I won't go back. Patio is nice and the place is clean.

Yq1f7p7r485xB2--50pU-w.text: $6 for fries is ridiculous. Burger, fries and a diet coke should not cost $20.

_abLmhngSxl-QxEXCPr4fA.text: My husband and I came in on a Friday night around 8 pm.. The bar area and dining room were dimly lit and to our surprise almost empty. We were told to take a seat. We sat and waited for our server until I believed to have been forgotten. We flagged a waitress down. She took our drink orders and sent our server to our table. Our drinks arrived 10 mins later. The mint was fresh in my Mojito however the limes in both our drinks were discolored and unpleasant looking.  A waitress came over beside our table and started polishing dinnerware and talking on her cell phone in a very loud manner. I wished she would have chosen a different table away from us to do this task as there were many others to chose from.  Our burgers arrived with a side of thin cut, crispy fries and burger fixins. We topped our burgers with the veggies only to realize that the chipotle mayo was missing. Our server apologized and bought us the condiment.  My husband and I each had a hard time eating our burgers. The kaiser roll they came on was just too tough for our liking.  With eat bite we took the inside of our burgers would push out into our hands. I ended up dumping my burger contents on my plate and just eating the patty. The patty itself tasted charred and was a very nice quality beef. They were cooked to our liking. The experience in this restaurant was okay, far from the worst and far from the best. Pretty much just a 'meh' experience.

nkRZ95-82NjXc9LQdVQgmg.text: Place is so good!! Fancy! Best burger ever!! they serve it on a pretzel, yum-o! Everything is cooked to perfection and is fresh and tasty. The place is so city looking, has a colorful bar and is a good date place without the city parking hustle and parking issue. I will be back, also i hear they have groupons be on the lookout!

3YD4KCOzM2lzoLIhOHzFtQ.text: Walking into Charr we had high hopes. They were flatten when we were greeted by the hostess who was seated behind the podium. Not only was the hostess seated,but we had to ask to be seated outside. The hostess never offered inside or outside seating.  Walking outside we noticed the many dirty tables, and the trash from previous customers littering the floor. In addition to the dirty tables, there was broken glass lying on top. The glass came from the lightbulbs above. So we moved inside.  Once inside  we were seated near a server station where you could hear the servers and hostess cursing. In addition to the foul language I witnessed a sever chasing the hostess around the restaurant with a dead bug!  I had ordered a beer on draft which was poured into a warm glass so with in minutes the beer was room temp and unpleasant. We both had burgers of course. I had ordered mine med rare and my girlfriend had ordered hers med well,both came out over and under cooked. For a burger bar I would think you would train your cooks to cook a burgers to order properly.  Truffle fries were nothing special have had better. And finally the bathrooms where so gross that most dive bars bathrooms where better then there's!! Overall would not recommend this place to anyone.

Vpa-rKuIDOob_QICIqPvNg.text: Awesome local restaurant with wonderful service. We went for burgers and a glass of wine and was not disappointed. The staff went the extra mile to whip up a fried egg to top our Carolina BBQ Burger. The meat was well seasoned and cooked to perfection. We'll definitely come back for happy hour!

6rli6OwzfPyjFZyYxMSxoQ.text: BEST BURGER IN THE WORLD! THE WORLD! Jesus himself would have loved this burger! Awesome service. Awesome music. About this time of year I usually get super fed up with X-mas music. So theydefinitelyget extra points in my book for that!

GWnPcskGovBCF3Bp3a95Vw.text: Best flavor chili chicken wings when not overcooked. Delicious with ranch. I keep going back just for these! Could do with providing finger tip bowls or wipes though, the sauce gets all over your face. Yummy!

UQlmtS8FVinSSzKPt-yZpA.text: Great local place for Moon Valley. Felt at home with Joe greeting all of the customers, just like at Aiello's in Central Phoenix. Burgers are good. Onion rings are lightly battered and tasty. Good selection of craft beers. Nice array of selections other than burgers too. This place will be one of our regular eateries. Congrats to Joe and Myrah for another great concept.

viM1spxsbCCMWKx1yN64YA.text: Love this food, Love the sister restaurant - Isa's and Sulmeria. Drinks are very good, Everyone treats us well- and I'm a pain :)

NtDfou6U_gG-ERlOD5-TCA.text: My husband and I went to Charr a few weeks ago.  I purposefully waited to write this since we wanted to re-try a couple of other places nearby for comparison.  We had 2 wedge salads, 2 burgers, an order of onion rings and 3 beers.  $60.  In the next two weeks we went to a nearby sports bar/Italian place and a brewpub.  For similar quantities, the price was $35 at one place and $38 at the other, both similar quality.  I have a hard time justifying the higher price tag, especially considering how loud it was at Charr, it was difficult to have a conversation.  The beer selection is good, but overpriced as was the case with everything.  Doing a la carte will be a tough sell when that is not what everyone else does.  We may return but not often unless the value gets better.  I wish them well but would encourage them to consider some changes that will price them more competitively.

GstZwHL31lV5NtSq5QT6AA.text: Great burgers, salads, and sandwiches. Although they just opened, service was quick. Using the garlic knots as buns is genius! Will definitely be back.

9sfZf5jV3gMq0EMrTC9qRg.text: I don't understand why people knock charr it's the only place in north phoenix that has a great drink menu and there food is goodn

0Pl192aJIVekvS8i9nr4RA.text: Great casual good. Great service. Quaint place. Pleasant atmosphere. I love this place and highly recommend it.  I just don't get some of these negative comments here. I've been there probably a half-dozen times over the past couple of months and have not had one negative experience (food OR service). If you don't like the prices, then all I can say is go to McDonalds next door.

zw6kr7eA9y9k-S1NOFTTOA.text: Ate there last night. Place should be great with nice surroundings, quality ingredients, and diverse menu. Restaurant failed at the two key places. A brand new server who was slow and inefficient was irritating, but the real sin was over cooking the burgers. 4 people at the table ordered medium and 1 was served medium and 3 well done.  I assume the beef was as high quality as everything else, but I had no way to tell with meat that over cooked.

ycEZlCXmeR_fvi5wXULmLQ.text: This was my first time to Charr!  I can promise it will not be my last time.  I had the portabello burger( FABULOUS), the truffle fries are truly worth writing home about, and OMG, the blueberry bread pudding with whiskey sauce.  I literally needed to be rolled out of the door with left overs for tomorrow!  Happy tummy for 2 days!

qTSzns7PzEXyP7G46s98hg.text: Not impressed with the goods....burgers were marginal, but fries were decent although the ticket time for a side order was approximately 20 mins, and the staff was very polite and attentive (that might be because we were the only two people in there at the time which was roughly 530pm).  Men's bathroom was run down (faucet falling off the wall), dirty, and smelled like stale urine....I understand it is a bathroom but it doesn't have to smell that way!   My biggest beef is the price of liquor.....$7.50 for a call brand liquor (we ordered Captain Morgan/Coke and Malibu/Pineapple) served in rocks glasses. This establishment is no where near trendy enough to be running these kind of prices. I have bar tending experience and have travelled enough to know when to pay those prices and Charr is not it.  Happy hour ran from 330-500(or close to that). This didn't make much sense to me...during the week most people are barely out of work by 5.  I might return for food only if I happen to be in the area, but will never seek out or recommend Charr.

TMtWhsTK47gYq_UBlYJA2w.text: Absolutley the worst turkey burger i have ever had. My date ordered the salmon salad.......no salmon. She had to substitute chicken. Really, no salmon on a the Friday night before Easter?  The turkey burger was over cooked and rubbery. The bun was stale and unedible. Absolutely zero flavor. What a waste of a Saturday night. As much as I like to support local mom and Pop's, I wont be able to support this one. PV burger Co, or Red Robin for me.

oCyQaGmfLNXFr1OJ0x8X3Q.text: Delicious burgers, soup, fries,  and flat-bread caprese!  I expected the bun to be more like the garlic knots but it had no special taste, just a different shape.  The service was a little slow, most noticeable when a table of 5 people that arrived 5-7 minutes after us were served 5 minutes before we were.

xLozGtIBoZWMUACM4KAfmQ.text: Just left charr. Had a great burger at the bar. service was good, food was good and I will diffently come back.

BlIBPnqf5BgllHh9sCZEOg.text: My husband and I had dinner here tonight and were very pleased.  I had a wonderful salmon dish and my husband had the Phoenix burger that he said was the best burger he's had in a long time.  The service was very good and very warm and friendly.

lHJ56o5mXe4u-NJ61CYJ7A.text: Wow. wOw. WOW. Did I say WOW, cuz WOW. And I mean wow in the best possible way! Party of 7 came by on a Friday night with no expectations, no reservations, and a 2 year old which can usually spell out a recipe for disaster but boy did Charr impress!   We were seated right away at a perfect size table and greeted immediately by our very friendly and very competent server. We received info on the specials as well as tips for first timers. Our drinks came right away and our server was even conscientious enough to ask if we should bring the 2 year old's food right away! (YES PLEASE!). Mr. Aiello himself came by to greet us twice and make sure that everything was perfect.   So, what did we have? I can tell you, I had one of the best salmon burgers I've ever had in my whole life. A delicious, perfectly cooked filet atop the most delicious house made garlic knot bun. What I loved most was the fact that the bun never got soggy from the lemon basil mayo sauce and the arugula was so fresh I'd swear that it was snipped that day!  The salmon was perfectly done. The baby had housemade macaroni and cheese that every adult at the table swore was the best ever. I think we might all have it next time as a main dish ourselves. 4 different cheeses mixed in the sauce and topped with a slice of cheddar and baked to perfection. O.M.G. Several of the grown-ups had the Phoenix Burger and the Charr Burger. Everyone said the burgers were DE-LIC-IOUS and cooked to perfection since so many of us have different degrees of doneness that we prefer.  Final friend had the pork tenderloin and while that fell a tad short versus the burgers, the overall dining experience left her feeling 5 star all the way.   Dessert was also superb. I had the Strawberries and Zabaglione sauce while others had the Apple Cobbler served hot with vanilla ice cream. All were super yum.   While this restaurant is very out of the way for us, we will definitely be making an effort to go out of our way again to visit Charr very very soon.  Thank you for a great experience and excellent food!

4RTAfI7Ka0MRVmbZ8lvXUw.text: Food was great. Had the portobello. Yummy!! Service was great. Was a little concern from reading previous reviews!! Only thing is that happy hour is limit to bar and patio and till 5. Place was empty at 6.  Will go again!!

aTSLsYKfzPmjmZygDR6ANA.text: Don't order the "fresh" blue point oysters! They were so over priced and not worth the money. Pappadeaux are way better and even cheaper. The service wasn't the best and there was only us and another table during lunch on a Sunday. Bathroom area smelled so bad. They had no changing table in the restroom. I understand just another reason why we won't be going back. Go to Moon Valley Cafe and get a better hamburger for way cheaper.

ucOVbX9HAk3A24Z_Icwb8Q.text: We had food delivered which can be dicey for a regular restaurant but I have to say we were impressed and surprised.  I had the Salmon with lemon sauce and capers, my partner had the Grilled Garlic Chicken - both were cooked perfectly, the potato cake was even in a separate container so the sauces did not soak up into them.  The portions were more than generous, even for the salmon.  I had dinner and lunch from the one dish.  I will definitely be ordering from them again.

1yC9IWvMohLZfL7WCHE_Dw.text: Great restaurant. Service is awesome. Owners care.....beer selections are different and very well .... prices are very reasonable.....it is very clean and has a nice patio. Definitely check it out. Mondays are Burger night......very inexpensive menu for a great food.

wJ3nACmS894acydfhAK-ZQ.text: From other reviews, this is a hit-or-miss place.  As Charr is near where we live and restaurant choices are not very good, we gave this try on a Wednesday night.  Easy parking.  Great ambiance.  Nice patio with a fire pit.  Got seated promptly.  Good start.  Water came.  Weren't familiar with the menu so we didn't order immediately.  Took a long time for the server to come back.  My water glass was empty again. We ordered a burger with avocado extra ($1).  Our menus were different and it wasn't clear that fries came with your order. It does in most places.  Ordered a flat-iron steak sandwich with bleu cheese---very good.  Enough for two small appetites.  The burger was overdone; no avocado, and a dried out bun.  A pile of "truffle" fries were placed in the middle of the table.  No dipping sauce (most upscale places offer that).  Wait staff was scarce in an almost empty restaurant.  Had to leave the table and go into the restaurant from the patio to get a check.  Commented that I felt invisible.  The waiter chuckled (wrong emotion). He gave us a small discount.  One can run up a big check here when you add in drinks and side orders of fries. But the quality does not justify these prices.   We are very generous tippers when service is good.  Our tip:  $0.00.  Another tip: Avoid this place.  Finally, a friend shopping at the nearby Safeway ran into a customer buying truffle oil spray (an employee from Charr).  They spray the oil on the friends--voila truffle fries.  Can't imagine this place surviving with service and practices like this to go with high prices.

6oAjfaTrFkmtaUKrUEY19A.text: Had a great experience here with my husband and two little kids.  The burgers were outstanding and the cocktails were perfection. Even the kid's meals were delish!  Perfect little local joint.

UGNg_jTdumn53t2YzIYodw.text: Stopped by Charr after church for lunch and truly enjoyed the experience.  My wife had their Turkey Burger and I had the Charr Burger made medium-well.  We also had their Truffle Fries.  They tasted great!!!  Our server, Gino, made our visit an excellent experience!!!  We will be back for more.

72n8Nac962sAEQcc4I16_g.text: I got out of class early tonight and I was starving. I drove by Isa's pizza which was, unfortunately, closed. I decided to stop in to Charr as they were still open and close by.  I sat at the bar and the bartenders we very friendly. I ordered the fried zucchini and a blue moon. They are very generous with the zucchini even though it is only an appetizer and the beer was cold and refreshing. The zucchini came with a side of ranch, but I prefer marinara, which they did not have, but they were able to accommodate me with their pomodoro soup which is very similar. I will definitely be going back and bringing friends. :)

2Y6_uQdAma_00bFk6TOApw.text: If I could do zero I would. For some reason you have to order at the bar for reverse happy hour pricing, which was deceiving. The buns were stale, the meat was less than decent, and the fries were comparable to Burger King. They had clear signage in the dining area boasting reverse happy hour with no mention of "their unique rule". This place flat sucked, myself and the wife could've spent nearly $100 elsewhere and left happy, but instead we left as if we were robbed. Who ever gave this place 3 or more stars has obviously no clue as to what a dining experience consists of. Thumbs down!!!! Twice!!!

UIGv4jm-3_p5P0y5pp-sZQ.text: When this restaurant first opened my wife and I were fans and since we were moving back to Moon Valley we were excited that MV was going to get a new good restaurant since there aren't many.  We got the Carolina Burger and the garlic knot bun was a great idea. The burger was juicy and delicious. The truffle fries were the perfect side for it as well. Anything truffle I'm a sucker for.  Last night we went again after a few months and it seems they forgot the butter and garlic on the buns and the truffle on the fries. The burger was pretty dry due to the dry bun and lack of any garlic and butter so it was just a knot bun really.   Not sure if it was a bad night, but if I truly hope they pick up the quality again because I want them to succeed here.  I'll give it one more shot and if it's good again, I'll be happy to update this review with 5 stars that I would've given it a few months ago when I first ate here.

oxDUa-anluuRrH57SDnOKA.text: Came in after work for a burger to go! Friendly staff, great atmosphere! Can't wait to actually go back and try more things on the menu! 2nd best burger I've ever had.

bw3quvCvR2hA_RIVVheKDQ.text: Way overpriced.  Love the decor and ambiance, but Delux prices don't work without top notch burgers.  And $6 fries is just ridiculous.

spskZ98NnAGHAFrC0C0wXg.text: Honestly, the only thing good about this restaurant is that it is in the neighborhood and we have very few restaurants to choose from in Moon Valley.  The food is just okay but the worst thing is the service.  We just waited 35 minutes for a bowl of soup, a salad and a kids meal of chicken fingers and french fries.  If we weren't so desperate for someplace to eat in this area, I would never go there!

L4QNAo0eXnHS9JEveYdZJA.text: Visited for Restaurant Week so we had a shared app (crab cake), two entrees (Carolina burger w/string fries and fish and "chips"/string fries) and shared dessert. The waiter was friendly but somewhat unattentive and tried to push the other restaurants/deli on to us quite a bit. The food was pretty mediocre but edible..no complaints. I'm not a huge string fry fan so I was hoping for some thicker cut "chips". The blueberry bread pudding was okay. It tasted like they used old garlic bread from the other restaurant next door then smothered it in whiskey and butter. We went about 15-20 minutes without a water refill and waited 10 minutes for our card to be picked up. All in all it was just okay but at least now we know and it only cost us $30. I guess that's what Restaurant Week is all about though right?

rraqj8cgUDox6bjaI1VQsA.text: Fantastic food and awesome service from our server John! Great experience! I had a steakhouse burger and sweet potato fries, both were delicious!

jTHbuS7fifft5efL6dsjyQ.text: Nicholas my subordinate from work suggested that we should try this place because it looked cool.  So we jump into the car and drove a bazillion miles to get here.   The place definitely looked cool in person and it was well kept and clean.  The loo was pretty decent as well for a burger joint.  The staff were super friendly and helpful because this was our first time eating here.  Service was good speed, and no mistakes were made.   To the food, Nicholas order their signature burger, and we split their mac and cheese... which was absolutely amazing! It's definitely not the best I had, but close enough.. and I highly recommend it.  I also order some wings which was okay, they were really tough to chew.   Overall a good place.  Probably won't come back again since it's so very far.

Opm4pp8EUdf9FOSw4fXNdA.text: This is a crazy place. I've visited twice now. Both times have sat on the dog friendly patio. I've had a different waitress each visit however, they both seemed so uninterested in being at work. Also the yelp hours listed never seem to match what they're open. Last time as we were leaving another couple showed up thinking they were open till 10 weekdays.   Here's the saddest part, I love the location and the menu. But the wait staff is so unwelcoming it's amazing. First visit ( we think they're open till 10(yelp listed) we show up at 8:15. At 8:45 while eating our entrees the waitress turns off the fire and starts closing down. Ok ok we're done can we have a box?  Tonight our waitress had three tables (all outside) we ordered a salad and an appetizer and twenty minutes later they show up with our entree right behind when we ordered them at least 10 minutes apart. Our waitress spent the majority of her time in at the bar with the other staff eating pasta from a to go container from somewhere.   Ok also don't order the veggie burger. I know I know it's a meat place, but I was trying to make a healthy option tonight. Tasted like when I tried a Pinterest fail recipe. Just get a burger.

XEcjDOhlDZwqAQEp5HBJCg.text: The food is FANTASTIC. Zucchini, pickles, artichoke dip, wings, French onion... all amazing. Highly suggest coming!!! Drinks are great too!

photos.caption: Photo of Charr An American Burger Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States

SkJ5mUot3jOf4wopMXxT9Q.text: Food=excellent. Delicious juicy big burgers with every topping you can imagine. Truffle fries- crunchy, salty and plentiful. Service- fast and friendly. Burgers and fries came out together. Burgers cooked the way we asked for them. No onions as specified. Butter lettuce! Yum!  Extra ketchup immediately upon request.  Can't believe it has taken us this long to discover this hidden gem in our own neighborhood. Oh and the music rocks! We'll be back

uA9GiQm_ePt9SVy5XR1nDg.text: I had been looking forward to reading at Charr for weeks. I really wish I could critique the food but unfortunately I cannot. I showed up today on Jan 1 for lunch at about 11:15 and the place was closed. They didn't have a sign up stating they'd be closed either. Then to top it off make I walked up to the door as saw employee walking around the kitchen. A couple employees made eye contact with me and walked away out of sight. No visit or explanation. Really? What the heck?

XpuYvRhuoULAOv_x-RQL0w.text: I used to visit Char quite frequently, but stopped coming for a while. I'm happy to say that when my son and I went there tonight, the service was great, the food was tasty, and the atmosphere was pleasant. We even hung out for an hour+ playing pool. Their reverse happy hour looks promising--and it is the only reverse happy hour in the area.  We shared the Char burger and fries, because we didn't want to over do it, and it was filling and tasty. I'm glad to see this successful business in Moon Valley. Great job, Joe and Myra.    :)

o-0BoC8_aGZuIB4o7v4zEQ.text: This place actually has amazing burgers. I first tried it a few months ago. Good atmosphere and music lovely staff pool tables. One of my buddies is actually a cook there also and the kitchen is clean and great tasting food. Highly  recommend this spot to just come hang and enjoy. I honestly do not drink but have friends who do and know that the drinks are honestly reasonably priced. The only thing I have to say is that the pool games are a dollar a piece a little expensive. Live bands on the weekend karaoke also on some nights just saying a great place to enjoy. Try it for yourself.

photos.caption: Photo of Charr An American Burger Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fun and games very good place to have a good time and eat a birger

NcRHgG3m3KiDl22QBVALsQ.text: Our server Alex was amazing but the cook in the back was so rude. My daughter and I came in at 9:30 and the restaurant closed at 10. We ordered our food and I ordered a to go order for my son as well. I asked our server Alex if she would wait to put in the order for my son until my daughter and I are almost finished. I overheard Alex telling the cook this and he started grumbling about the time. She then said please which is absolutely ridiculous. I ordered the grilled vegetables but did not like the flavor of them so I asked about 9:50 if I could have the fries instead when she went back to tell him she needed Fry's he had already drained the fryer and could not make my fries. He was very rude to our sweet server. The food was very good except for the vegetables but that's my preference. I may go back  but I hope this Cook has a different job by then.

sTMDqIjQMTuFEoLqaUQn4w.text: Well I have been around town pretty much I test everything and post reviews. And on that note I will NEVR post a bad review I will call the owner direct as it's not my choice to ruin any business.. I  love derek .. and my favorite things are the sweet potato fries the spinach dip and the fried pickles omg !!!!! Not to mention I'm a real advocate on mutts nuts man I love that beer . So stop by on a night when u can and tell them TK referred you    Humbly TK

rlyj4tU711ZQ6qYna5qQGw.text: This place was "okay." The highlight was the wings. Super yummy, everything else was just mediocre. The service was great, that's why I'm giving 3 stars.   I wouldn't eat here again, maybe I would pop for a milkshake. They didn't have values ice cream for the brownie so our server gave us two milkshakes instead to compensate. Like I said, awesome service.

umwXfegLPI26NxzrHmeHig.text: This place has great burgers! Their Carolina burger was to die for! I loved the bbq sauce, the caramelized onions and of course the bacon. I wasn't planning on eating all of the fries, but they were so crispy and good, I couldn't stop myself! My friend had their chicken sandwich with sweet potato fries. The chicken so flavorful. The sauce was spicy, but not too spicy. Delish! I have to give a shout out to our server, Kenny. He was excellent! He's super friendly and attentive and he even remembered the name of the beer I ordered the time before. Wow! If you are hungry for a burger and great service, stop in at Charr and ask for Kenny!

9dhXY0XYj0CMx0qn2BPOwg.text: This place used to be nice...not sure what happened...food and drink quality has gone down in the past few years.  At one time this was a True upscale burger bar and now it's just mediocre.

qEDLNNn16kMxJe0K0NzoeA.text: During restaurant week was my first time at Charr, my partner and I decided we wanted to try something new the Blonde waiter by the name of Kenny (I believe) helped us and was literally one of the best customer service interactions I had in a long time he was literally excellent since our first interaction. He greeted us with a warm smile and gave us such good recommendations, although we knew he was trying to up sales us at times with his recommendations we didn't mind because they were good. For the price the food was decent but the customer service we experienced might have us returning.

Vjq9Fdnh6vqDHQ-oeN2DDg.text: My husband and I came here for restaurant week and sat at a table for 20 minutes and still never got greeted after 4 tables were seated after us and had been helped. As I sat at the table I started searching for another place to eat. Finally I got up and asked who the manager was and told him we hadn't been taken care of yet. He asked if he could get me anything as we explained the situation. We ended up going to another place so can't say how the food is but we have no desire after seeing how their service and atmosphere was. No music, extremely rude servers and just a bad vibe overall. Would not recommend.

nHVEysChkzolYg7MG2b57A.text: This place has promise but struck out tonight. The burgers were good but not $12-$15 burgers good. Our server and service in general was not good, 30+ minutes for a burger order and lack of table service was like we were a burden on servers time. We were served water with two chipped rims and she did not seem to care once we found her. Customer service lost this restaurant 2 stars and 5 less guests in the future.

RHdSsdNMZaHxWaJKa0YJXg.text: I went to happy hour here with my mom and brother on Friday and it was really great!!!  The food was DELISH and the service on point!  We'll be back!

YEBaREhhM2WmFF6bdeYd8A.text: The service was very prompt, they treated us very friendly and made sure that our experience was very valued. The burgers were great, and cooked to perfection.  You could taste the truffle in the fries, it gave the fries a very good flavor.  I also enjoyed the chipotle ranch they offered.

yCRpWaHa-5r1OQR0NJjS2Q.text: We decided to try this burger place a month ago after a good review from a coworker.  We come to Phoenix for business frequently, and come to CABG frequently whenever we are in town.   Our waiter Kenny, was attentive and funny!  He helped to make the night.  The food was delicious we loved the pickle chips, and our burgers were great.  Our waiter, Kenny brought our food promptly and in the right order, perfectly timed.  We have been back since and actually requested to be seated in Kenny's section.  WE have decided to make this one of our go to places whenever we visit.   However, the beer could be more reasonably price, but we solved that by having water and soda. We highy recommend this restaurant.  If your waiter can't make it right the manager also seemed helpful after observing him at another table.  Luckily we didn't have any problems with our waiter!  update: visited again a few weeks ago and asked for Kenny's section.  He remembered us and made us feel welcome.  This time we had a game of pool to relax.  Still as happy with food and server!

yALyznLVJb2-T8JfWrCDvg.text: I have been here 3 times. The food is very good. They have a good menu, and an excellent beer and liquor selection! The first two times I came here, the service was horrible. Our servers paid no attention to us, forgot to bring us our drinks after we ordered, and acted like they didn't want to be here. I decided to give it one more shot due to the quality of the food and beverages. Finally, I was not disappointed! My server, Ashley was wonderful. Not too overbearing, but ver friendly and present. She paid attention to details, and fulfilled every need I have. I am glad that I can continue to come here! Ashley gets 5 stars! Due to previous experiences, I am giving 4 to Charr.

ssEvOARxnrK8TAn33_khTQ.text: This place is delicious. I absolutely love it. The funny thing is my favorite thing there is their mac n cheese. I just wish they had a full plate to order instead of just sides. I end up buying like 3-4 sides just for my self. Other than that the environment is great the people are awesome and the food is on point.

HKo-Oalil7nFeEsvFdDbbA.text: Wow they have a great hamburger now, even my wife is telling me so and she's a salad person.  I ordered mid-rare and it was perfect.

rwKAjaPj4FCVmGXslxnr2w.text: Much-needed upscale place in Moon Valley.  Cheated on my standard, Ammacapanne's, 3 times to try this place.  Much better fare, but much worse service.  This most recent visit, the hostess seated us and I asked for a reminder on what the WiFi password was (I'm not a total douche...my wife and I run a small biz together and commonly work over meals and drinks).  The hostess kinda curtly said she didn't know if the place even has WiFi (I knew it did) and didn't know the password if it did.   No effort to go get it.  Finally waited for a server, who vaguely thought she knew it.  I'm not in the HRM industry, except as a consumer, but I can't imagine not training my staff on this.  Love the ambiance and food. Just disappointing service in my 3 visits.  The servers at Ammacapanne's still win the day in this area for me.

XoOm9j1OEB9DEF46hz-wnw.text: Very good fries, very good house baked pretzel buns, good beer list on tap and bottle, blueberry bread pudding with whiskey sauce was amazing. Service was fast and nice enough. Only letdown was the burger itself? Underwhelmed by the pizza burger. Everything else was good.

h457PK7jrlIDm-4QCKuJsA.text: Just returned from an excellent dinner at Charr -- our entire party of four enjoyed their burgers, and the service was gracious, efficient, and complete. I had the Turkey Burger, which was delicious and easily altered as per my requests. Instead of fries, I ordered the grilled veggies, which were perfectly done. Our waitress, Claudia, was very professional and extremely attentive. (I am glad that we did not take those negative reviews below to heart. Instead, we gave Charr a chance to prove those reviewers wrong, and we are certainly glad it did.) We look forward to returning.

Gw1pJhh6bubcCgjBeebDIw.text: We came for the first time and the server was kind and friendly, although never told us her name. We ordered the Mac N Chz burger and a turkey burger version of the Carolina burger. A regular next to us suggested as I ordered to get the sauce on the side. This was helpful and made it enjoyable to eat. We both had our fries crispy because that's how we like em. We were delighted by the shoe string truffle fries. They were crispy and flavorful. The service was average Friday night timing and the owner touched base to see how we were. The lighting is romantic, the atmosphere a quiet roar and the price point on par for the items being served. We will be back.

rCU-9-jL6tJmBdtWXwVUBw.text: We love that we have found a good burger place close to home! I had the Hawaiian turkey burger, modified slightly because I'm not a spam fan, the burger was delicious and I loved the sweet potato fries. My husband had the Mac N Chesse burger, he enjoyed his burger especially the garlic knot bun!

upwY6SCTe09mkXFPuTGF5g.text: New to arizona looking for a local watering hole and grub spot. Mission accomplished. I sat at the bar and was greeted immediately by Jolene the cheery bartender. She recommended an IPA which I believe was from utah or new mexico cant remember; regardless delicious. I ordered fried pickles and watched a baseball game till my mammoth burger topped with mac n cheese with bacon arrived, followed closely by a good size basket of fries that were finished in truffle oil. Bomb. Fully fed and watered I paid, thanked everyone for the great service and dipped. I deducted one star for it being very dark and I think there were electrical problems cuz the music was goin in n out here n there. The servers know some pretty funny jokes as well. Ill be coming back and ill bring the crew with me. Save our seats!!!

YDfcomJEqPnXts70Ie7HvA.text: Monday night burger special was awesome. Our server was very attentive and friendly. We will be back next Monday.

1WCi2_htcwPV9rXfZ5cR3w.text: We stopped in on a recent Fri. night.  There was live music on the patio but we opted to sit inside and were immediately seated.  The restaurant was 1/4 to 1/3 full but we sat there through at least 4 songs (about 15-20 min.) and no one asked us if we wanted a drink, brought us a glass of water, or acknowledged our presence in any way.  The hostesses were directly behind us, there was wait staff milling around chatting and cleaning other tables, a chef was chatting it up on the patio with other guests but we were completely ignored. I would've liked to try the food but the service was non-existent (other than being immediately seated by the hostess) so that we wound up walking out.

r0aPUvV32Q_5bPHJUniDwQ.text: So I went back to Charr after my initial visit to take the boyfriend in. What man doesn't love a burger?! Well he loved it....until he found a hair in the meat. I hope for their sake this was a one-time thing but we haven't been back since.  Bummer because I like supporting local places but it was one hair too many.

SIHgIe6rd5Z2RNo92csJOQ.text: Nice patio and good service.  I had the Phoenix burger with truffle fries - both tasty.  I was there for happy hour and told that happy hour only applied to the bar & patio, so I opted for the patio even though I was one of a handful of people there in the middle of the day.  I enjoyed my visit, but wouldn't say it was spectacular.  If I am in the area, I will stop in again.

ALAVtjOAhfE7faEv_EB8oQ.text: Not with another visit. Saturday nite not busy. Should have known. 1st wine on wine list Prosecco out. Went to Aiellos and they were out. How is an Italian restaurant out of  Prosecco?  Do not get the shrimp salad. The dressing is store bought, the shrimp was over cooked and was so bland. Asked for new and got worse. We sat at the bar only patrons, Husband only got water and had to asked for refills. Moscow Mule and bbq burger were tasty, hence the 1 star. Again not with another visit.

8g21yy5V9_tFi7G44R_2WQ.text: Went there a few times before and had the best mac n cheese bacon burger. Never had any issues whatsoever. Tonight went in with a group of 5. Two of the people work there and one did a no call no show since the owner refused to allow her to call in sick. We all went in and the owner refused service to all of us and made us all leave. I have never dealt with such unethical business practice. Just because an employee quits or does a no call no show because you refuse to allow her to call out sick you automatically ban them from eating there and the people they bring in... I was planing on buying the $14 burger a side of mac and cheese and a few mixed drinks.. So you lost a few customers.. Great owner..

4adpATybQAVf2OF0AtQwDw.text: I usually don't do reviews but my service was so good I had to give them props. The pretty Latina waitress Drea was so kind and caring, kept up with my table and drinks even on a busy night. Food was awesome and can't wait to come back and try another fabulous burger.

bP-jNfubZBgNmosta0II2w.text: Love this neighborhood spot! Great place to grab a beer and burger after work but don't rule out the rest of the menu! Killer spicy chili wings and crab cakes! Top it off with a milkshake for dessert you won't regret it!

CRJBSjd4n65ezu1gLbFQUQ.text: I got a burger asked for medium. I got we'll done with over salted fries. My girlfriend got a salad. Which looked like cut up condiments for the burgers on top of romaine lettuce. The lettuce was mainly the heart of the romaine which was yellow.  Cool looking place that's about it. After visiting here I really don't want to attempt to visit aiellos. Don't want to get disappointed.

hPJw7RyqkCXcKBHC2TgPSg.text: We are regulars here. We love the food and the service. I'm shocked at the service critiques. We've been here a lot, and only once did we have mediocre service. Otherwise it's been terrific. I love the Buffalo Chicken sandwich, but really everything here is  excellent. I like the onion soup or the wedge salad for a starter. The burgers are tasty and too much to eat even for a big guy. The beer and wine selections have what I like. The atmosphere is just right. Not only that, but they will bring up Italian from their deli if you ask. What's not to like about Charr?

K0l3ygN0BnFEGXj3qfAzsg.text: Atmosphere was good, service was good, onion rings were absolutely amazing.   Ordered my burger mid rare, but it came raw.   They did the right thing and comped the burger....we will give them another try, because had the burger been cooked right, I'm sure it would have been great and they were nice people, doing the right thing.

7oZx0N0fKxwvvh8NaDAclw.text: I went to Charr for the second time. I was with my father who lives in nearby Moon Valley. He was eager to try Charr after a neighbor recommended it. It was a complete failure.   GOOD NEWS: burgers now come with side of  fries for the same price.   BAD NEWS: The service was horrible. We just ordered burgers. I had the Carolina (with bbq sauce ON THE SIDE) he ordered the Phoenix burger. In only a few minutes our food was brought out by a someone from the kitchen. They asked, "who had the Carolina?" and set the plate in front of me when I responded and then gave the other burger to my father.   My burger had BBQ on it (not on the side as I ordered) had it came on the side I would not have touched it. My fathers burger was just a plain cheese burger. We figured that we got someone else' order as it came out so fast. My father told the waitress about his lack of "Phoenix" in his burger and she went to the kitchen before I could get to my BBQ sauce issue or our theory of it being for a different table. Someone came from the kitchen and took the "Phoenix" burger away and came back 20-30 seconds later with roasted pepper on it and left. We got the waitress again to say that it still didn't have the chipotle mayo and she left immediately to get some despite me trying to tell her about the bbq burger I did not want.   We told the waitress when she came back with the mayo that my burger had bbq on it and not on the side, but rather than having them recook my burger (they took my burger away but left my father to eat his) we just abandoned the meal. Also we never got flatware and/or napkins the entire time.   Overall we spent 3 or 4 times longer trying to get our servers attention and get the order fixed (not including time it would take to fix mine had we stayed) than it took to get the food after we ordered.   We are not picky eaters nor complainers. But they failed to do accommodate our one simple request (no bbq) and also simply forgot two components (the only two things that make it a "Phoenix" burger rather than a cheese burger) on another and made it a circus trying to fix them rather than just simply scrap the two burgers and remake them again correctly.   The whole experience made me think that they just did not give a s**t. Little to no effort by the waitress and how can a kitchen claim they make great burgers if their solution to missing components it just to add them several minutes after they serve the food.

3wTc5HDdVsW6jxkwJYc0qw.text: Sat at the bar. Ordered the Bison burger and Blue Moon. It was outstanding. Alexx was my server. She had great attitude. Very friendly. Service was prompt. Very reasonably priced. Highly recommend

27wPhCI7RTWyEGpXvNeV3g.text: We'll not be back...Poor service, plus poor attitude....never got a drink or our food...

GkIIe6BssSiybK3W8LltKw.text: We stopped in for a "quick" appetizer and drink. We had somewhat limited time. Ordered a draft beer and cocktail and a couple appetizers. No one else at any of the tables, four people at the bar and two bartenders. Sat there for 20 minutes, when one of the bartenders came to us to say they did not have the brand of vodka asked for. We canceled our drink orders. The server came over to apologize, saying it was his first day. He also threw in "We weren't prepared. It might take a while for the kitchen... " At that point we decided maybe it wasn't meant to be and told the server we were leaving. Total time : 25 minutes.

oXZwPrh4OISq02gZ1pfToQ.text: Have been wanting to try this place for a really, really long time and decided to try it with my husband and son for our anniversary. Went on a hot Monday evening about 6ish to find only two tables (both with seniors) occupied...uh oh. After reading mixed reviews we grumbled on the way in how our dining experience was going to be. Wrong!  Was immediately greeted and seated. Menu is fairly short so it didn't take long. French Onion for me, Crab Cake Sandwich for him, Charr Burger+ American cheese for the 10 year old.  My husband's soda was flat but my son's wasn't. Uh oh. Waitress kindly brought another. Food took a little longer than average due to the fact it wasn't busy.  When the food arrived it was without the fries, which our waitress said was on the way. She was correct, they arrived shortly there after. My soup was smoking and I mean smoking hot. I loved my soup, it was almost perfect. Onions were cut fairly small and it wasn't overloaded with cheese like FOS is sometimes. My husband's crab cake sandwich was damn near picture perfect. Lots of arugula with a small drizzle of the "tartar sauce". My son's burger was thick, a little over cooked and accompanied with a fresh tomato slice, onion and butter lettuce. Those fries are amazing and worth the trip! Thin, crispy and salty.  Our drinks were never empty and our server was personable, I think her name was Ashley.  We will definitely be back to Charr we thought the food was great and with just a few minor tweaks it would have been a 5 star experience.

7kXgQ0v4d3wK7PqOGYdDtA.text: We live across the street and have been coming here since they opened. I hate to say but we will not be back after last night-I went in last night and sat at the bar-I recognized the bartender who I had walked out on once before because of poor service-I went ahead and sat at the bar hoping this time would be better and I would not be overlooked like the last time-well once again the service was horrible-I watched for 25min(not exaggerating)while the bartender would bring food to other patrons or drinks that were sitting only 1 barstool away from me-the bartender never acknowledging me or even looked over to let me know they knew I was there but would be right with me look-so on that note I actually had to get the bartenders attention so I could get the tab for the beer they didn't even know they had on the menu-and the bartender was surprised when I asked for the bill but then realized why-the bartender apologized and took care of my $5.00 tab but that did not help at that point-Joe should spend more time in the kitchen then out greeting people-maybe a staff meeting once a month-something, anything to get the staff excited to be there-I have watched that place go through countless employees and the service is still crappy-the food is also going downhill-maybe close the place down and stick to making pizza-I Will now make the 5 min drive over to the tavern on 32nd st and Shea where service and food are way better-peace out Char

yLLFB5UxC_OrPcxUnU8ccw.text: I started to become a regular.. I enjoy the food and the place is close by.. today I had an incredibly poor experience that literally has me pinching myself to see if I'm awake.   Wings ($9.50) were so covered in sweet chili sauce I literally was salvaging them with napkins. I ate one and was unable to stomach the rest.   I had two cocktails, both ordered during happy hour. My bill had three drinks 1x$10 2x11  I kindly expressed my food quality issue and the waitress asked me if she could box the wings. What? No sorry, no offer to make new ones.. nothing.   When I asked why the bill stated two prices for the drinks, she stated that I made a mistake about the time I ordered it.. (after happy hour)  So.. I left. I called and asked for the manager and he was defensive like a child would be.   I can't remember a time, ever, that I've felt bent over by the service industry.   Do yourself a favor and eat at ziggys or literally anywhere other than this place. The energy is bad.

Sb9WOXs1IG66Zt41W2ZBfw.text: So many things wrong with my first visit.  Friend promises it is better than the experience I had. Placing a bookmark to try again later, but for now.. First visit was horrible.

juJfbfOVe507a0_6Wpl1Ag.text: We went here years ago but decided to give it another go the another night after hearing about Charr Cade...they have opened the other side up with some games such as pool and our teen wanted to play.  Unfortunately they charge to play so we passed.  We started out with an order of fried pickles and a beer. They do have a large selection of beer with something for everyone. My husband ordered a burger loaded with bacon and make and cheese, my son had the basic Charr burger and I had the buffalo chicken sandwich. I really did not like my sandwich at all. The chicken was on the rubbery side and the sandwich would fall apart and drip buffalo sauce everywhere every time you tried to take a bite. The little that I ate I had to eat with a fork. The truffle fries were decent though even though they didn't show up until several minutes after our burgers were served. My husband and son liked their burgers which is how they ended up with 3 stars.  The service was a bit spotty as it took a bit to be seated when we arrived even though they were fairly empty and the server was slow with refills and taking our order but it does seem to be a good local spot to grab a beer.

iPOBMvqE0ibXyfR1vNRD0A.text: ***NOT EVEN BAR RESCUE CAN FIX THIS ONE****. Horrible, worst service in the world. "Cooks first night" four beers ordered and didn't have, charged for two drinks we didn't get, and food came an hour and a half after we ordered. Yes you read that right, place is a ghost town.. should be on bar rescue. Staff couldn't tell me when they close, clueless idiots working here.

4DPo-U3gz1K6P9Tb4WqhMQ.text: First off, maybe this is biased as I worked here... but why not give it a go.   I'm giving this place a 3 star rating, for good reason.   First off, their food is pretty good. They use natural hamburger with literally no seasonings, yet it's super good. Their fries are to die for. All of their salads, appetizers, and drinks are pretty good. I liked the menu!   The management can be tough to handle. Joe, the owner is a True New Yorker which means he is rough and tough. He has ZERO filter, and a lot of times he made me feel awful. I can handle my grit, but not being yelled at while busy. It just shouldn't happen. The people that work there are pretty down to earth and I got a long with 97% of them. When it's busy though, it can be understaffed as they don't believe in putting wait times out. Which, I think would help. When you're busy and get sat 4x in 10 minutes... someone is going to get forgotten. It's inevitable. The restaurant is pretty cramped on a Friday night when it's busy.   The alcoholic drinks are pretty pricey TBH. Even on happy hour. They need to re-evaluate that. They need to have a good team on, but it's hard in the environment. You should be able to trust your co-workers and management.   If you go here, enjoy the food and atmosphere. Joe and Myrah did good at trying to liven the place up. I don't go out much, but I would love to see how things have come along since opening up the "game" area.

-5h3lxlr_tYR1jyCuEBpZw.text: We went to  Chars for Mothers day and 1 birthday.   They had no idea we had reservations made for 8 earlier.  Worst experience you can imagine.  Server didn't deserve any tip..kept disappearing for long periods of time.  Girls kept peeking out from the kitchen.   Big gaps of time to even see waiter around.  All food was horrible.  My daughters really shouldn't have paid at all for any of the meal.  Only 2 other customers there.  Strong feeling no supervisor was around.  I would love to talk to the owner..he's being ripped off, as we were.  Used to like this restaurant...never again...not a Happy Mother's day .  Joy and family

Ou83RyRGIyHLE-LuQZ_n0A.text: Wouldn't recommend this place for food, perhaps for a beer and some music in the evening, but definitely not for lunch. The restaurant looked dirty, sticky floors and tables, dirt and dust and the peek into the kitchen worried me. When the food came out, I was very underwhelmed. A $2 upcharge for a side salad that was just a few pieces of lettuce, red onion and tomato, so I asked for cucumber slices and they came out yellow and charged an extra $1.50. It wouldn't have been annoyed if you got fries in addition to, but that wasn't the case. $14,50 for a chicken sandwich and the piece of chicken was small, heavily breaded and tough. The small $5 milkshake for my niece's birthday (no dessert offered to celebrate) was bland and she only drank a few sips. Best food ordered was the chicken wings, so I'd recommend that if you do find yourself here. Won't be back.

utp_CsiVLD3Pds1Xks-tEQ.text: Highly recommend!  The hamburgers were really good! The patties were perfect! Amazing onion rings and French fries.  Service was outstanding! I'm a food snob and this place good.

e_hQrXAX9fRiY57ux_3krw.text: Hit up Charr: An American Burger Bar this evening for Arizona Restaurant Week 2018!  Not only was it my first time at Charr, but it was my first time participating in Arizona Restaurant Week!  So the premise behind Arizona Restaurant Week is it allow us (the consumers) to try new restaurants and new menu items at a somewhat discounted rate.  My wife and I paid $33 for us as a couple for an appetizer that we shared, two entrees and a dessert that we also shared.  Drinks and anything else are excluded.  The restaurant is in a little strip mall of sorts right on Thunderbird in Phoenix.  Very convenient location with plenty of ample parking!  The first thing I noticed when I walked in was this gigantic chalkboard in front of me that said - MILKSHAKE BAR.   Sold!  ...except, I wasn't there for a milkshake, but it sounded good.  I may need to come back for a milkshake at some point in time.  Forget about the milkshake for now.  Anywho, the restaurant was clean and do not let the word "bar" fool you.  Yes, there just happens to be a bar in the restaurant, but I would not call it a bar, per se and we were not there to do any heavy drinking, anyway.   Back to my review... we were seated right away and considering it was a Friday evening during Arizona Restaurant Week, I was pleasantly surprised.  Music was playing and it was loud enough to hear the lyrics, but not loud enough so that you couldn't hear yourself think or carry on a conversation with your hot date.     We were waited on promptly and our drinks were brought very quickly.  We knew more or less what we wanted so it did not take long for our food to begin piling up on our table.  For our appetizer, we went with Panko Parmesan Zucchini.  The panko was golden brown, crispy and delicious.  The zucchini was still crispy and not mushy.  It was very green and fresh!  So delicious!  The perfect appetizer that didn't leave you feeling stuffed.  It was the perfect start to our meal.  For my entree, I opted for the salmon burger.  You can probably tell from my other reviews that I absolutely heart salmon .  I mean, I could seriously eat salmon every day of the week if my wallet allowed it.  The salmon was grilled to perfection and quite fresh.  It wasn't skunky like salmon can be and it wasn't dried out like it can be so easily.  On top of the salmon was a hefty bed of fresh mixed greens in addition to several slices of fresh red onion, a couple slices of tomatoes and several pieces of fresh butter lettuce.  Soooo good!  The bun was fresh, warm and awesome.  I've had several salmon burgers and this one from Charr is one I'd recommend for Restaurant week!  The burger was accompanied by a small trough of skinny fries.  They appear to love the use of parmesan cheese as the french fries much like the panko zucchini was lightly sprinkled with salt and parmesan cheese.  An awesome compliment to my salmon burger!  For dinner, I was hoping to obtain the cobbler, but sadly enough, they were sold out of it.  We instead opted for the brownie which was baked fresh in-house and still warm and then smothered with a large helping of vanilla ice cream.  I don't think I need to go into gory details about the brownie.  I would've taken a photo of it, but my lovely wife dug into it faster than you can say "restaurant week".  I'm pretty much stuffed right now, but terribly happy.  The perfect start to our Memorial Day weekend as we're thinking about our veterans and those who paid the ultimate sacrifice.  I will end this review by saying I would highly recommend a visit to Charr.  I know Arizona Restaurant Week is ending this weekend, but a visit to Charr is still a worthwhile endeavor for your next meal out with family and/or friends.  The service was pleasant, quick and polite.  The food... well, I think I discussed the food enough and I think you'll be pleasantly surprised just as I was.  Thanks for having us and thanks for letting us spend Restaurant Week with you guys!

OcQtVkSgfaMhKr7CkrDosA.text: They were close and I felt like a burger.  Big mistake. Flavorless, dry but greasy burger. I asked for the burger medium-rare. It came out at least medium.   The "truffle" fries came out after my burger...10 minutes after....and I had to ask the server to check on it.  Server was so overly friendly & enthusiastic that it was annoying- after finally getting my fries, he came by & asked if the fries were " just as fabulous" as the burger. Seriously? No they were not fabulous. They were greasy and didn't taste like they had even a hint of truffle oil on them...  Not a good experience at all. Why is it called Charr? My burger had no char on it. I will not be back.

UQACAHftdi1Dz6sqBR7bzA.text: Just moved in the neighborhood thought we would try this place. When we walked in stood at the door for about 4 min before we were seen. We were ordering drinks and the waitress said she didn't know much about the beer they carried because she don't t drink beer.. ordered a sour beer and waitress came back and said she couldn't find the bartender.. 10 min later she came back and said she looked in the back and there was no sour beer but on the chalk board it is listed. Finally got another beer.Very disappointed with the food,McDonald's has better tasting burgers. We will never go back.

iipo5fMgTrhr_njUiPo0Eg.text: I would give this place zero stars if that was an option, me and my boyfriend came in during happy hour. The place was basically empty, we sat at the bar which was infested with fruit flies. Ordered beers which the one we wanted was out. Keg was tapped, didn't offer to change it.
